intro: Roupala veraguensis, commonly known as the Veraguas roupala, is a small evergreen tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, spherical fruits. Roupala veraguensis is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and montane forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
